intro: Kickxia spuria subsp. spuria, commonly known as the common rockcress, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with small, cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Its leaves are basal, rosette-like, and have a rough, hairy texture. The flowers are white or pale yellow, arranged in a raceme, and bloom in early spring.
